description: Define complex xml literal using namespaces.
code: xml x2 = xml `<book ns0:status="available"> <ns0:name>Sherlock Holmes</ns0:name> <author>Sir Arthur Conan Doyle</author> <!--Price: $10--> </book>`; x2
expr: <book xmlns="http://ballerina.com/" xmlns:ns0="http://ballerina.com/aa" ns0:status="available"> <ns0:name>Sherlock Holmes</ns0:name> <author>Sir Arthur Conan Doyle</author> <!--Price: $10--> </book>

description: Define complex xml literal using ${} notation.
code: string title = "(Sir)"; xml x3 = xml `<ns0:newBook> <name>Sherlock Holmes</name> <author>${title} Arthur Conan Doyle</author> <!--Price: $${ 40 / 5 + 4 }--> </ns0:newBook>`; x3
expr: <ns0:newBook xmlns="http://ballerina.com/" xmlns:ns0="http://ballerina.com/aa"> <name>Sherlock Holmes</name> <author>(Sir) Arthur Conan Doyle</author> <!--Price: $12--> </ns0:newBook>
